intro: Lappula setosa, commonly known as the silky lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its seeds are small and wind-dispersed, aiding in its propagation across various environments. Lappula setosa is often found in temperate regions and is relatively hardy, adapting well to a range of climatic conditions.
